title: The Complete Sherlock Holmes - Sir Arthur Conon Doyle.epub
description:
The Complete Sherlock Holmes

Inevitably, Holmes rescues the innocent, confounds the guilty, and solves the most perplexing puzzles known to literature.

Volume I of The Complete Sherlock Holmes starts with HolmesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s first appearance, A Study in Scarlet, a chilling murder novel complete with bloodstained walls and cryptic clues, followed by the baffling The Sign of Four, which introduces HolmesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cocaine problem and WatsonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s future wife. Tired of writing stories about Holmes, his creator, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, killed him off at the end of Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Final Problem,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ the last tale in The Memoirs. But the public outcry was so great that eight years later he published the masterful The Hound of the Baskervilles, which supposedly takes place before HolmesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s death.

The separate Volume II of The Complete Sherlock Holmes collects the remaining accounts of HolmesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s exploits, including Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Adventure of the Empty House,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ which reveals the elaborate circumstances behind HolmesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s literary resurrection.
